snippet: Exxon Mobil and Royal Dutch Shell reported lackluster third-quarter earnings because of declining oil and natural gas production and weak domestic gas prices, but refinery operations were strong.
abstract: Exxon Mobil and Royal Dutch Shell report lackluster earnings due to declining oil and natural gas production and weak domestic gas prices; Exxon Mobil reports third-quarter net income of $9.57 billion, down from $10.33 billion a year ago, with revenue down 8 percent to $115.71 billion; Shell reports net earnings of $6.6 billion, down from $7 billion in year-ago quarter; reports $7.14 billion quarterly profit, up 2.3 percent from year ago, after including extraordinary items and inventory changes.
lead_paragraph: Exxon Mobil and Royal Dutch Shell reported lackluster third-quarter earnings because of declining oil and natural gas production and weak domestic gas prices, but refinery operations were strong.

headline.seo: Earnings at Exxon Mobil and Royal Dutch Shell Helped by Refining
headline.main: Exxon and Shell Earnings, Hurt by Natural Gas, Are Helped by Refining
headline.print_headline: Exxon and Shell Earnings, Hurt by Natural Gas, Are Helped by Refining
